name: All American Apple Pie Filling
ingredientsText:
7 or 8 tart cooking apples, pared, cored and sliced thin. (golden delicious, macintosh, rome, gala)
6 tablespoons flour
3/4 cup sugar
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon nutmeg
2 tablespoons butter
preparationText: Prepare pie crust.  Put apples in a large bowl.  Toss with lemon juice. Set aside.  Preheat oven to 400 degrees.  In a small bowl, combine flour, sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg.  Sprinkle about 1/4 cup of the mixture on the pie crust and add the rest to the apples.  Stir to coat the apples.  Fill pie crust heaping full of apple mixture.  Dot with butter.  Place top crust over the filling.  Press edges together and flute as desired.  Cut slits in top crust, creating an apple shape, add leaves from leftover pie dough. Bake about 50 minutes, or until crust is golden.  serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

name: Almond Apple Cheesecake
ingredientsText:
Crust:
1 cup flour
1/3 cup sugar
1/2 cup butter
1/3 cup raspberry jam
Filling:
2 packages cream cheese
1/2 cup sugar
2 eggs beaten
2 teaspoons vanilla
Topping:
1/3 cup sugar
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
3 cups thinly sliced tart apples
1/2 cup sliced almonds
preparationText: Combine Crust ingredients press into spring-form pan bake at 350 F for 10 minutes. Let cool

name: Almond Crusted Fresh Fish
ingredientsText:
2 Tbsp Olive Oil	
Fresh Fish cut 1/2 inch thick (4 ea 4oz wt pieces)
Salt and Pepper	to taste
1/2 cup Almond Crust (see recipe)
1/2 cup Lemon Butter Sauce (see recipe)
Your favorite side-dish	(2 servings)
Your favorite vegetables (2 servings)

Almond Crust:
1 slice of Fresh White Bread
¼ cup of Honey Roasted Sliced Almonds
2 Tbsp Butter, melted
1 tsp Lemon juice, fresh squeezed
1 tsp Chopped Fresh Parsley

Lemon Butter Sauce:
1 Tbsp Olive oil
1 tsp Chopped garlic
2 Tbsp White wine
1/2 tsp Thyme, fresh	
1 cup of Heavy Cream
3 threads of Saffron
1 Tbsp Lemon Juice, fresh squeezed	
2 Tbsp Butter cubes, cold
Salt and white pepper to taste
1 tsp Cornstarch
1 tsp Cold water
preparationText:
Lightly season the fish on both sides with salt and pepper. Heat a 10" sautÃ¨ pan over medium high heat then add the olive oil. Place the seasoned fish in the heated pan and reduce heat to medium; sautÃ¨ the fish for 2-3 minutes per side, just until it flakes easily and is cook through. Transfer the fish to a warm serving plate and top the fish with the warm almond crust (see recipe). Serve with heated lemon butter sauce (see recipe) and your favorite side-dishes Enjoy!

Almond Crust:
Place slice of white bread into food processor or blender and pulse to make coarse bread crumbs. Lightly toast bread crumbs on a cookie sheet pan in a 350°F oven (4?5 minutes). Measure out ¼ cup of bread crumbs and save the rest for another use in the freezer. Place all the ingredients in a small mixing bowl and mix to evenly combine. Warm the topping for 30 seconds in the microwave just prior to serving over the fish.

Lemon Butter Sauce:
Add the oil to a heated small sauce pan. Add the garlic and sautÃ¨ for 30 seconds. Add the wine and thyme; reduce by half. Add the cream, saffron and lemon juice; bring to a boil and immediately reduce heat to low. Add the butter cubes and stir until combined. Mix the cornstarch and water in a small bowl and add slowly to the sauce, while stirring until thickened. Season the sauce with salt and white pepper to taste. Strain the sauce through a fine mesh strainer and serve hot.

name: Aloha Bread
ingredientsText:
2/3 cup butter
1 cup sugar
4 eggs
1 cup mashed bananas
4 cups flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon bakin soda
3/4 teaspoon salt
20 ounces pineapple, drained
3/4 cup chopped pecans
1 cup coconut
preparationText: Grease 2 large 8x4 inch loaf pans; set aside. In large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs; stir in bananas. In separate bowl, mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt; add to banana mixture. Blend well, but do not overmix. Add pineapple, pecans and coconut; mix on low speed until blended. Pour into prepared pans. Bake at 325 degrees for 60 to 80 minutes.

name: Amish Friendship Cinnamon Bread
ingredientsText:
Starter Days 1-9
1 cup Flour
1 cup Granulated sugar
1 cup Milk
Starter for Friends
1 cup Flour
1 cup Granulated sugar
1 cup Milk
Wet ingredients
1 cup Oil
1/2 cup Milk
3 Eggs
1 teaspoon Vanilla
Dry ingredients
2 cups Flour
1 large box Vanilla instant pudding mix
1 cup Granulated sugar
1 teaspoon Baking powder
1/2 teaspoon Baking soda
1/2 teaspoon Salt
2 teaspoons Cinnamon
preparationText:
Days 1-6: Add Starter ingredients to a one gallon ziplock bag.  Mush starter 2 times a day.


Days 7-9:  Mush the bag and let air out 2 times a day.


Day 10:  Pour starter into a large bowl.  Add flour, sugar, and milk and stir.  Pour one cup of starter into 4, gallon sized ziplock bags.  Give bags and copy of recipe to 4 friends.  A small amount of batter will be leftover.


To batter add oil, milk, eggs, and vanilla.  In a separate bowl mix flour, pudding mix, sugar, baking powder, soda, salt, and cinnamon.  Mix wet and dry ingredients together.  Mix 1/2 cup sugar, and 2 tsp. cinnamon.  Grease or spray one bundt pan, or 2 loaf pans.  Sprinkle cinnamon sugar in the pan(s) to coat the inside.  Pour batter into pan(s) and sprinkle remaining cinnamon sugar over the top.  


Bake at 325 F for 1 hour


Optional ingredients: 


1 cup chopped nuts


1 cup chocolate chips


1/2 cup raisins or other dried fruit


1/2 cup coconut


Instructions for friends:


Day 1: Do nothing


Day 2-5:  Mush bag 2 times a day


Day 6:  Add 1 cup each flour, sugar, and milk.


(Days 7- 10 as above.)

name: Apple Crumb Nut Muffins
ingredientsText:
2 medium apples finely chopped
2 cups flour
1/2 cup sugar
1 tablespoon baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
3/4 cup milk
1/4 cup oil
1 teaspoon vanilla
Topping
1/2 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup white sugar
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
1/8 teaspoon cloves
2 tablespoons flour
1/4 cup melted butter
1/4 cup chopped nuts
preparationText: Chop apples with skins on. Mix dry ingredients and add apples. Mix wet ingredients and add to dry mix. Stir till just mixed. Spoon into muffin tins 2/3 full, sprinkle topping generously on top of each muffin. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes.

name: Apple Hill Cake
ingredientsText:
1/2 cup vegetable oil
1 cup sugar
2 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla
1 teaspoon cinnamon
2 cups flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon baking soda
4 cups of apples chopped small
1 cup chopped walnuts

Topping
1/4 cup butter
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 cup evaporated milk.
preparationText:
Bake cake at 350 degrees from 30 to 50 minutes.
Boil topping for five minutes, stirring constantly. Pour over the hot cake.

name: Arroz con Leche
ingredientsText:
2 cups rice
1 gallon milk
Cinnamon to taste
Vanilla to taste
Lemon peel
Sugar to taste
2 Eggs
preparationText:
Put the milk and cinnamon on heat, stir so that it doesn't stick until it comes to a boil.

Wash the rice 3 times in a colander. Mix with the milk. Bring to a boil again, stirring so that it doesn't stick. After it boils, turn down the heat and stir every 5 minutes.

Once the rice is tender, add the lemon peel and sugar. Stir so that it doesn't stick.

When it's ready, take it off the burner and add the eggs and a little milk in the blender and blend it.

name: Asparagus Chicken Crepes
ingredientsText:
2 eggs
3/4 cup milk
1/2 cup all-purpose flour
3/4 teaspoon sugar
1/2 cup condensed cream of chicken soup, undiluted
1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
1 dash ground nutmeg
1 cup chopped cooked chicken
1 cup cut fresh or frozen asparagus, thawed
1/3 cup chopped fully cooked ham
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese, divided
1/2 cup heavy whipping cream, whipped
1/3 cup mayonnaise
preparationText:
1. For crepe batter, beat eggs and milk in a small mixing bowl. Combine flour and sugar; add to egg mixture and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.

2. Heat a lightly greased 8-in. nonstick skillet; pour 3 tablespoons batter into the center of skillet. Lift and tilt pan to evenly coat bottom. Cook until top appears dry; turn and cook 15-20 seconds longer. Remove to a wire rack. Repeat with remaining batter, greasing skillet as needed. When cool, stack crepes with waxed paper between.

3. In a small bowl, combine the soup, Worcestershire sauce and nutmeg. Set aside 1/4 cup. Add the chicken, asparagus and ham to remaining soup mixture. Spoon 2 tablespoonfuls over each crepe; roll up tightly. Place seam side down in a greased 9-in. square baking pan. Spoon reserved soup mixture over crepes. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese.

4. Cover and bake at 375 degrees F for 20-25 minutes. Gradually fold cream into mayonnaise. Spread over crepes. Sprinkle with remaining Parmesan. Broil 6 in. from the heat for 3-5 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown.

name: Avocado Lime Cheesecake
ingredientsText:
1 1/2 cups cream
3/4 cup white sugar
1 1/2 ripe avocados, peeled and pitted
2 (3 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened
1/2 cup fresh lime juice
1 (8 inch) prepared graham cracker crust
preparationText:
1. Heat the cream in a small saucepan until small bubbles appear around edges. Remove from heat and stir sugar into the cream until it dissolves. Transfer to a medium bowl, and allow to cool.

2. Combine the avocado and cream cheese in a food processor and blend until smooth. Add the lime juice and process until smooth, then whisk into the cooled cream mixture.

3. Fill an ice cream maker with the mixture, and freeze according to the manufacturer's instructions.

4. Spoon into the prepared pie crust. Smooth surface with a spatula. Freeze at least 2 hours in freezer before serving.

name: Baked Orange Roughy
ingredientsText:
Tartar Sauce:
1/2 cup mayonnaise
1/4 cup sour cream
1/4 cup sweet pickle relish
1 tablespoon Dijon mustard

1 cup finely crushed cornflakes
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1 teaspoon dried basil
1 teaspoon dill weed
1 teaspoon paprika
1/8 teaspoon pepper
1/2 cup milk
1-1/2 pounds orange roughy fillets
Lemon wedges
preparationText:
For tartar sauce, in a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, sour cream, pickle relish and mustard in a small bowl. Cover and refrigerate.
                            
                            
                                   In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the cornflake crumbs, Parmesan cheese and seasonings. Place the milk in a shallow bowl. Dip fillets in milk, then place in bag and shake to coat. 
                            
                            
                                   Arrange in a greased 15-in. x 10-in. x 1-in. baking pan. Bake at 450° for 10-15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with tartar sauce and lemon.
                                        Yield: 6 servings. 
                            
                    
                        
                            Originally published as Baked Orange Roughy in  Country Extra
September  2003, p49                                    
                        
                    

                            
                                
                                    Nutritional Facts
                                    
                                         1 serving (1 each) equals 331 calories, 19 g fat (4 g saturated fat), 41 mg cholesterol, 502 mg sodium, 18 g carbohydrate, trace fiber, 21 g protein.
