name: Baked Yeast Doughnuts
ingredientsText:
2 pkg. active dry yeast 
1/4 Cup lukewarm water 
1 1/2 Cups milk, scalded 
1/3 Cup butter or margarine 
2 eggs 
1/2 Cup sugar 
2 tsp. salt 
1 tsp. nutmeg (1 to 2) 
4 3/4  c flour (4 3/4 to 5) 
Melted butter or margarine
 
BUTTER CREAM FROSTING: 
1 lb. sifted powdered sugar 
1/3 cup butter (softened) 
3 to 4 tbsp. cream (can use canned milk)
preparationText:
Soak yeast in lukewarm water. Add butter to scalded milk and cool to lukewarm. Add yeast. Beat eggs; add sugar and beat again; add to milk. Add salt, nutmeg and beat flour in thoroughly, adding only enough to make a very soft dough. Cover and let stand in warm place until double in bulk. Or let rise in refrigerator until double in bulk, about 3 1/2 hours. 

Roll out onto lightly floured board, about 1/3 of the dough at a time. Roll to 1/2-inch thickness. Cut with well-floured doughnut cutter or cut into rectangles about 1 1/2-in. wide and 4-in. long. Place about 2-in. apart on well greased baking sheets. Brush well with melted butter or margarine. Let rise in warm place until double in bulk.

Bake in 425ºF. oven about 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Roll in sugar or ice with powdered sugar frosting. 

You may wish to use use canned frosting. The frosted top may be dipped in coconut or finely chopped nuts.

name: Baking Powder Biscuits
ingredientsText:
4 teaspoons Baking powder
1/2 teaspoon Cream of tartar
2 cups Flour
1/2 tsp Salt
2 tablespoons Sugar
1/2 cup Butter
1 Egg
1/2 cup Milk
preparationText:
Blend dry ingredients and butter. Cut with mason ring.
Put in 9x9x2 pan.

Bake at 400° F for 15 minutes.

name: Banana Bread
ingredientsText:
2 cups flour
1 cup sugar
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon soda
1 teaspoon baking powder
2 teaspoon cinnamon
3 bananas
2 eggs
1/2 cup oil
1/2 cup applesauce
1 teaspoon vanilla
preparationText: Bake 350 F, 30-40 minutes

name: Banana Nut Bread
ingredientsText:
6 large or 8 medium bananas, very ripe
4 eggs
2 cups sugar
3/4 cup oil
4 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
2 teaspoons salt
2 teaspoons salt
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 cup walnuts, chopped
Grease well and flour 2 large loaf pans; set aside. Peel bananas and place in large mixing bowl; mash bananas well. Add eggs, sugar, and oil; mix until well blended. In separate bowl, mix flour, baking soda, salt, and baking powder. Add to banana mixture. Mix until blended. Add nuts and mix briefly. (Overmixing cases tunnels and a coarse texture.) Pour into prepared pans. Bake at 325 degrees for 45 to 50 minutes or until wooden toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

name: Bread Pudding
ingredientsText:
2 eggs
2 cups scalded milk
1/4 cup butter, cubed
3/4 cup sugar
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
4-1/2 to 5 cups soft bread cubes (about 9 slices)
1/2 cup raisins, optional
Vanilla Sauce:
1/3 cup sugar
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1/4 teaspoon salt
1-2/3 cups cold water
3 tablespoons butter
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
preparationText:
In a large bowl, lightly beat eggs. Combine milk and butter; add to eggs along with sugar, spices and vanilla. Add bread cubes and raisins if desired; stir gently.

Pour into a well-greased 11-in. x 7-in. baking dish. Bake at 350° for 40-45 minutes or until a knife inserted 1 in. from edge comes out clean.

Meanwhile, for sauce, combine the sugar, cornstarch and salt in a saucepan. Stir in water until smooth. Bring to a boil over medium heat; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Remove from the heat. Stir in the butter, vanilla and nutmeg. Serve with warm pudding.

name: Breakfast Bundt
ingredientsText:
1/2 cup Margarine
1 cup Sugar
2 Eggs
1 teaspoon Almonds
1 teaspoon Baking powder
1 teaspoon Baking soda
1/2 teaspoon Salt
8 ounces Sour Cream
Sauce
1 cup Whole cranberry sauce
1/2 cup Nuts
preparationText: Mix first 3 ingredients. Add dry ingredients alternating with sour cream. Pour 1/2 batter into bundt pan. Pour 1/2 cranberry on batter to 1/4" of edge. Top with batter, then sauce.

name: Brown Sugar Rhubarb Muffins
ingredientsText:
3 cup flour
1 1/2 cup Brown sugar
1 teaspoon Baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
1 cup Buttermilk
2/3 cup oil
2 teaspoon vanilla
3 cup rhubarb; 2 c. diced, 1 c. chopped
Topping
1/4 cup Brown sugar; Topping
1/4 cup sugar; chopped
1/2 teaspoon Cinnamon
preparationText:
Mix flour, brown sugar, baking soda, salt. - Beat eggs, oil, vanilla and buttermilk.  Then stir into dry ingredients just until moitened - Fold in Rhubarb and nuts.


Bake 375 F


18-20 minutes

name: Butterscotch Bubble Loaf
ingredientsText:
24 Rhodes rolls; thawed, but still cold
1 box non-instant butterscotch pudding mix
1/2 cup chopped pecans
1/2 cup butter or margarine; melted
1/2 cup Brown sugar
preparationText: Spray bundt pan with non-stick cooking spray. Cut rolls in half and roll in dry pudding mix. Arrange in pan alternately with pecans. Sprinkle remaining pudding mix over the top. Combine brown sugar and butter; heat together until butter is melted and a syrup is formed. Stir well. Pour syrup over rolls. Cover with sprayed plastic wrap. Let rise until double in size or even with top of bundt pan. Remove wrap and bake at 350Ã‚° F for 30-35 minutes. Cover with foil the last 15 minutes of baking. Do not underbake. Immediately after baking invert onto a serving platter.

name: Caramel Apple Streusel Bars
ingredientsText:
1 can (8 oz) PillsburyÃ‚® Crescent Recipe CreationsÃ‚® refrigerated seamless dough sheet
3 cups chopped peeled cooking apples (2 large)
1/2 cup caramel topping
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 cup butter or margarine, softened
3/4 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 cup quick cooking oats
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/2 cup chopped pecans
preparationText:
Heat oven to 375°F. Spray 13x9-inch (3-quart) glass baking dish with cooking spray. Unroll dough; press in bottom and 1/2 inch up sides of pan. Sprinkle apples over dough.

In 1-quart saucepan, heat caramel topping and 1/4 cup flour to boiling over medium heat, stirring constantly. Boil 1 minute, stirring constantly, until thickened. Drizzle over apples.

In medium bowl, mix brown sugar, flour, oats and cinnamon. With pastry blender, cut in butter, until mixture looks like fine crumbs. Stir in pecans. Sprinkle evenly over apples.

Bake 18 to 22 minutes or until top is golden brown and apples are tender.

name: Carrot spice muffins
ingredientsText:
1 3/4 cups flour
1 1/2 teaspoons Baking powder
1/4 teaspoons Baking soda
1 1/2 teaspoons Pumpkin Pie spice
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 egg; beaten
3/4 cup Buttermilk
1/2 cup Brown sugar
1/4 cup oil
1 1/2 cup shredded carrots
topping
1/4 cup chopped walnuts
4 teaspoons sugar

name: Cherry Nut Bread
ingredientsText:
3/4 cup sugar
1/2 cup oil
2 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla
2 1/4 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 jar (8 ounces) maraschino cherries, drained (reserve juice), and slightly chopped
1/2 cup walnuts, chopped
preparationText: Grease and flour two 8x4 inch loaf pans or line with waxed paper; set aside. In large mixing bowl, cream sugar and oil; add eggs and beat well. Stir in vanilla. In separate bowl, mix flour and baking powder. Measure 1/2 cup maraschino cherry juice, or add water to make 1/2 cup. Alternately add flour mixture and maraschino cherry juice to creamed mixture until all ingredients are blended. Stir in cherries and nuts. Pour into loaf pans; bake at 325 degrees for 55 to 60 minutes or until wooden toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

name: Cherry cobbler
ingredientsText:
1 cup sugar
1 cup flour
1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
Dash of salt

Mix

3/4 cups milk
1/4 cup butter
1 quart cherries
preparationText: None were given.

name: Chicken and Sausage Gumbo
ingredientsText:
3/4 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 pound smoked sausage -- sliced
3/4 pound chicken breasts -- cook and shred
1 cup chopped onion
1/2 cup chopped green pepper
1/2 cup chopped celery
8 cups water
2 cloves garlic -- minced
1 bay leaf
1 1/2 teaspoons cajun seasoning
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
1/4 teaspoon black pepper
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
dash hot sauce
3/4 cup sliced green onions
4 cups hot cooked rice
preparationText: Prepare chicken breasts and shred. Set aside. Brown sausage, onion, and green pepper in skillet. Drain fat. In Crock-Pot, combine shredded chicken, sausage mixture, celery, water, and seasonings. Cover and cook on Low 6 to 8 hours or on High 3 to 4 hours. serve over rice and garnish with the green onions.

name: Chocolate Cheesecake
ingredientsText:
1 cup crushed chocolate wafer crumbs
3 tablespoons sugar
3 tablespoons butter, melted
2 cups (12 ounces) semisweet chocolate chips
2 packages (8 ounces
3/4 cup sugar
2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
2 eggs, lightly beaten
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Strawberries and white chocolate shavings, optional
preparationText:
In a small bowl, combine cookie crumbs and sugar; stir in butter.  Press onto the bottom of a greased 9-in. springform pan; set aside.  In a microwave, melt chocolate chips; stir until smooth. Set aside.

In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese, sugar and flour until smooth. Add eggs beat on low just until combined. Stir in vanilla and melted chocolate just until blended. Pour filling over crust.

Bake at 350° for 40-45 minutes or until center is almost set. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Carefully run a knife around edge of pan to loosen; cool 1 hour longer. Refrigerate overnight.

Garnish slices with strawberries and chocolate shavings if desired. Refrigerate leftovers.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredientsText:
1 cup Butter
1 cup Sugar
1 cup Brown sugar
2 Eggs
2 teaspoons Vanilla Extract
3 cups Flour
1 teaspoon Baking soda
1 teaspoon Salt
2 cups Chocolate chips
preparationText: Preheat Oven to 350. Cream wet ingredients and Sugars. In another bowl combine dry ingredients. Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients, then add chocolate chips. Roll into balls and cook for 10 minutes

name: Chocolate Cranberry Kiss Cookies
ingredientsText:
1/2 c. butter
1 c. all-purpose flour
3/4 c. sugar
1 egg
1 tsp. vanilla
1/2 tsp. baking powder
1 c. quick cooking rolled oats
1 c. coarsely chopped cranberries
1/2 c. finely chopped walnuts
42 milk chocolate kisses
preparationText:
In a mixing bowl beat butter with an electric mixer on medium to high speed for 30 seconds or until softened. Add the flour, sugar, egg, vanilla and baking powder. Beat until thoroughly combined. Stir in oats, cranberries and nuts.
Drop by round teaspoons onto a greased cookie sheet. Place a chocolate kiss in the center of each cookie. Bake in a 375 oven for 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Remove and cool on a wire rack. Makes 42 cookies.

name: Chocolate Mint Surprise Cookies
ingredientsText:
1 cup butter
1 cup sugar
1/2 cup brown sugar
2 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla
3 cup flour
1 teaspoon soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 packages (4 oz) chocolate mint wafer candies

name: Cinnamon Peach Kuchen
ingredientsText:
2 cups flour
2 tablespoons sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 cup cold butter, cubed
2 cans (15-1/4 ounces
1 cup packed brown sugar
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
2 egg yolks, lightly beaten
1 cup heavy whipping cream
preparationText:
In a small bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt and baking powder; cut in butter until crumbly. Press onto the bottom and 1-1/2 in. up the sides of a greased 9-in. springform pan.

Place pan on a baking sheet. Arrange peach halves, cut side up, in the crust. Combine brown sugar and cinnamon; sprinkle over peaches.

Bake at 350° for 20 minutes. Combine egg yolks and cream; pour over peaches. Bake 25-30 minutes longer or until top is set. Cool on a wire rack. Refrigerate leftovers.

name: Cinnamon Raisin Strata
ingredientsText:
1/4 cup butter, softened
3 tablespoons ground cinnamon
8 slices day-old raisin bread
4 tablespoons brown sugar,
6 eggs, lightly beaten
1-1/2 cups 2% milk
3 tablespoons maple syrup
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Additional maple syrup
preparationText:
In a small bowl, combine butter and cinnamon; spread over one side of each slice of bread. Place four slices, buttered side up, in a greased 8-in. square baking dish (trim to fit if necessary). Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons brown sugar. Repeat with remaining bread and brown sugar.

In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, syrup and vanilla; pour over bread. Cover and refrigerate overnight.

Remove from the refrigerator 30 minutes before baking. Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 40-50 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Serve with additional syrup.

name: Coconut Bread
ingredientsText:
3 cups Flour
1/2 teaspoon Baking powder
1/2 teaspoon Baking soda
1/2 teaspoon Salt
2 cups Granulated sugar
1 cup oil
4 Eggs
2 teaspoons coconut extract
1 cup Buttermilk
1 cup Nuts
1 cup Coconut; shredded
Topping
1 cup Granulated sugar
1/2 cup Water
1 tablespoon coconut extract
preparationText:
Mix all ingredients together.


For topping boil water and sugar for 5 mins then add extract.


Bake at 350 F 45-55 mins.

name: Coffee Cake
ingredientsText:
4 1/2 cup flour
1 cup sugar
5 teaspoon baking powder
1 1/2 teaspoon salt
2 cup milk
3 eggs
1/4 cup oil
Topping (Streusel)
2 tablespoon brown sugar
1 tablespoon butter
1 teaspoon cinnamon

name: Cookies with box caked mix
ingredientsText:
1 package cake mix
1/2 cup shortening or butter
2 eggs
4 tablespoons water
preparationText:
Blend ingredients.
Bake 350 degrees for 10 minutes.
cool on cookie sheet.

name: Cornmeal Muffins
ingredientsText:
1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
1 Tablespoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
3/4 cup yellow cornmeal
2 large eggs
1 cup milk
6 tablespoons oil
2 tablespoons sugar
preparationText: Sift together flour baking powder, and salt to taste, stir in cornmeal. Lightly beat eggs, then add in the milk and oil. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients, pour in the wet ingredients, stir gently until just combined. Spoon into muffin tins and bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.

name: Cranberry Pork Medallions
ingredientsText:
1 pork tenderloin (about 1 pound), cut into 1/2 inch slices
3 Tablespoons Olive oil
1 medium onion, finely chopped
3 tablespoons sugar
1 garlic clove, minced
1 cup apple juice
1 cup fresh or frozen cranberries, thawed
2 teaspoons dijon mustard
1/2 teaspoon minced freash rosemary or 1/8 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed
preparationText: In a large nonstick skillet, cook pork in oil for 3-4 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Remove and set aside. In the same skillet, saute onion, garlic and sugar until onion is caramelized and tender. Stir in the apple juice, cranberries, mustard and rosemary. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 5-6 minutes or until sauce is reduced by half. Return pork to pan; heat through. Sprinkle with additional cranberries and rosemary if desired.

name: Cream of Wild Rice Soup
ingredientsText:
1 1/2 cups diced yellow onion
1 cup diced carrot
1 cup diced celery
2 cloves garlic, minced
1/2 tablespoon olive oil
1 1/2 cups diced kale
1 tablespoon minced parsley
2 cups reduced sodium vegetable stock
1 teaspoon fennel seeds
1 teaspoon black pepper
1 cup unsalted white beans, prepared
2 cups 1 percent milk
1/2 cup wild rice, cooked
preparationText:
Saute onion, carrot, celery and garlic in olive oil in a soup pot until lightly brown.  Add kale, parsley, stock and spices. 
In blender, puree beans with mil.  Add bean mixture to soup, bring to simmer and add rice.  Cook for 30 minutes. Serve in warmed bowls.

name: Crepes
ingredientsText:
4 Eggs
1/4 teaspoon Salt
2 cups Flour
2 1/4 cups Milk
1/4 cup Butter
preparationText: Cook

name: Cut-out Sugar Cookies
ingredientsText:
Cream
1 cup butter
2 cups sugar
Add
2 eggs
1 cup milk
2 teaspoons vanilla
1 teaspoon lemon
5 cups flour
1 teaspoon soda
1 teaspoon sa  lt
1 teaspoon cream of tartar

name: Cutout Sugar Cookies (Lion House)
ingredientsText:
2 cups granulated sugar
1 cup butter
3 eggs
1 cup milk
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 teaspoon lemon extract
6 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon baking soda
3 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
Butter Cream Icing:
3/4 cup butter
3/4 cup Shortening
4 2/3 cups powdered sugar
1 1/2 teaspoons lemon juice
1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla
1/3 cup water
preparationText: Line cookie sheet with waxed paper; set aside. In large mixer bowl, cream sugar, shortening, and eggs. Add milk, vanilla, and lemon extract; mix at low speed. In separate bowl, mix flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda. Add to sugar mixture until well blended. Roll out 1/8-inch thick; cut into desired shapes. Bake at 400 degrees for 6 minutes, being careful not to overbake. Cookies should be light golden brown around the edges. Frost with Butter Cream Icing.

name: Date Nut Bread
ingredientsText:
1 1/2 cup water; use just 3/4 c. to cook, add cold to cool it off
1 cup dates; chopped
2 teaspoon Baking Soda
1 tablespoon Shortening; melted
3/4 cup Granulated sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 egg; beaten well
2 1/4 cup flour
1 cup nuts; chopped
preparationText: Simmer water and dates together for 3 minutes, cool slightly, then add soda. Combine remaining ingredients, then add nuts and date mixture. Blend well. Bake at 350 F (makes 2 loaves) for 1 hour.

name: Double Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredientsText:
1 cup Butter
1 cup Granulated sugar
1 cup Brown sugar
2 Eggs
3 1/2 cups Flour
2 teaspoons Baking Soda
1/2 teaspoon Salt
1/2 cup cocoa
1 cup Chocolate chips
1 cup Nuts; Coarsely chopped
preparationText: Preheat the oven to 350 F. Cream butter, brown sugar, sugar and eggs. In another bowl combine dry ingredients. Pour the dry ingredients into the butter mixture, stir well. Stir in the chocolate chips and nuts. Roll into balls and bake for 10 minutes.

name: Double Chocolate Pudding Pie Recipe : Ellie Krieger
ingredientsText:
14 graham cracker squares (7 full sheets)
2 tablespoons butter, melted
1 tablespoon water
1 tablespoon unflavored gelatin
1/3 cup boiling water
2/3 cup sugar, plus 1/2 teaspoon
1/3 cup cocoa
1/4 cup cornstarch
1/8 teaspoon salt
3 cups 1 percent low-fat milk
2 ounces bittersweet chocolate, chopped
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1/4 cup heavy cream
preparationText:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a 9-inch pie plate with cooking spray. 


		In a food processor, process the graham crackers until finely ground. Add butter and water and process until the crumbs clump together. Press the crumb mixture into bottom of pie plate and about 1-inch up the sides. Bake for 10 minutes, then let cool.


		In the meantime, make the pudding. Put the gelatin in a small bowl, add the boiling water and stir until dissolved. Set aside.


		In a medium saucean mix the 2/3 cup of sugar, cocoa, cornstarch and salt. Gradually add half of the milk, whisking until smooth. Whisk in the rest of the milk. Turn the heat on to medium and cook, whisking constantly, until the mixture thickens and comes to a boil, about 10 minutes.


		Remove from the heat. Add the chocolate and stir until melted. Stir in the vanilla and reserved gelatin. Pour the mixture into the pie crust and let set for 3 hours in the refrigerator.


		Whip the cream and remaining 1/2 teaspoon of sugar. Before serving, garnish the pie with the whipped cream.

name: Double Layer Pumpkin Cheesecake
ingredientsText:
2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened
1/2 cup white sugar
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 eggs
1 (9 inch) prepared graham cracker crust
1/2 cup pumpkin puree
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1 pinch ground cloves
1 pinch ground nutmeg
1/2 cup frozen whipped topping, thawed
preparationText:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).

2. In a large bowl, combine cream cheese, sugar and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Blend in eggs one at a time. Remove 1 cup of batter and spread into bottom of crust; set aside.

3. Add pumpkin, cinnamon, cloves and nutmeg to the remaining batter and stir gently until well blended. Carefully spread over the batter in the crust.

4. Bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until center is almost set. Allow to cool, then refrigerate for 3 hours or overnight. Cover with whipped topping before serving.

name: Dried-Fruit Focaccia
ingredientsText:
2 cups dried cherries
1 cup golden raisins
3 cups boiling water
1 cup extra-virgin olive oil
1 pound 10 ounces (about 5 cups) all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
1/2 cup granulated sugar
1 tablespoon instant yeast
1 tablespoon coarse salt
1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/4 cup coarse sanding sugar
preparationText:
Step 1
										In a large bowl, combine the cherries and raisins with the boiling water; let soak for 10 to 15 minutes. Drain fruit, reserving 2 cups of the soaking liquid; set fruit aside. Add 1/4 cup olive oil to the soaking liquid. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the dough hook, combine the flour, granulated sugar, yeast, salt, and cinnamon; mix just to combine. With mixer on low speed, add reserved fruit and soaking liquid. Mix until the fruit is evenly distributed but the dough is still tacky, about 3 minutes.


																			
																	
										Step 2
										Turn out dough onto a lightly floured work surface, and knead for 1 minute. Pour 1/2 cup olive oil onto a 17-by-12-inch rimmed baking sheet, coating the bottom completely. Place the dough on top of the oil, and use your hands to spread it out as much as possible without tearing (it doesn't have to fit the pan). Cover the dough loosely with plastic wrap, and continue to pat and press the dough toward the edges. Set pan in a warm place, and let rest, pressing out the dough every 10 minutes until it fills the pan, about 45 minutes. Let rest until doubled in size, about 1 hour. Meanwhile, place a baking stone on the floor of the oven. Preheat oven to 425 degrees


																			
																	
										Step 3
										Using your fingers press dimples into dough. Drizzle dough with remaining 1/4 cup olive oil, and sprinkle evenly with sanding sugar. Set the baking sheet directly on the stone and bake, rotating sheet halfway through, until focaccia is deep golden brown on top and bottom, 35 to 45 minutes. Immediately slide the focaccia onto a cutting board to cool. Use a pizza wheel or a serrated knife to cut bread into triangles, and serve warm. Focaccia can be kept at room temperature, wrapped in plastic, for 2 to 3 days.

name: Easy and Delicious Cream Pie Filling
ingredientsText:
1 package 3.4 ounce instant jello pudding in flavor of your choice (banana cream, coconut cream, chocolate cream, butterscotch cream)
1 cup milk
Softened vanilla ice cream (1 half gallon container will make 3 pies)
preparationText: Pour milk into a large mixing bowl.  Add pudding and beat with electric mixer until thickened.  Add softened ice cream (remove from freezer and let sit on counter for 10 minutes or so to soften).  Beat with mixer until creamy and well mixed.  Using a rubber scraper pour into prepared pie shell.  Refrigerate until set, approximately 1-2 hours. Serve with whipped cream and garnish as desired. Chocolate curls or sprinkles, banan slices, coconut etc.

name: Empanadas
ingredientsText:
1/2 cup butter, softened
1 (3 ounce) package cream cheese
1 cup sifted all-purpose flour
1 cup fruit preserves
1/3 cup white sugar
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
preparationText:
1. DAY BEFORE:  Cream butter and cream cheese together until smoothly blended. Beat in the flour.  Shape dough into a smooth ball, wrap in foil or cling wrap, and refrigerate overnight or up to a week.
2. AT BAKING TIME:  Remove dough from refrigerator 30 minutes before using.  Start heating oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
3. Roll chilled dough thin. Cut with 3 or 4 inch round cookie cutter.  Place small spoonful of jam in center of each round, moisten edges with water.
4. Fold round over and press edges together.  Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 15 to 20 minutes.  Immediately roll in sugar mixed with cinnamon (traditional) OR in confectioners' sugar if preferred.

name: English Trifle
ingredientsText:
2 cups raspberries fresh or 16 ounce package frozen. Or strawberries, bananas.
2 cups peaches canned or frozen.
sugar
1 pound poundcake
3 cups vanilla pudding
sweetened whipped cream.  When using fresh fruit sprinkle with sugar and let stand 20 minutes . Do not sprinkle frozen fruit with sugar. Reserve 3/4 cup of fruit to garnish.
preparationText:
Cut poundcake in 1 inch cubes.
In a 3 quart glass bowl place 1/2 pound cake cubes on bottom next, 1/2 of the pudding, 1/2 of the raspberries, all peaches.
Add cake cubes, sprinkle with all juice from peaches and raspberries, add pudding.
Top with whipped cream. Cover refrigerate 8 to 24 hours.

name: Famous Pumpkin Pie
ingredientsText:
2 unbaked 9-inch deep-dish pie shells
1 1/2 cups granulated sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
1 teaspoon ground ginger
1/2 teaspoon ground cloves
4 eggs
3 1/2 (30 ounces) cups pumpkin
3 cups (two 12 ounce cans) Evaporated milk
preparationText:
Combine sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger and cloves in medium bowl. Beat eggs lightly in large bowl. Stir in pumpkin and sugar/spice mixture. Gradually stir in evaporated milk. Pour into pie shells.
Bake in preheated 425 degree oven for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350 degrees and bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean.

name: Filled Sugar Cookies
ingredientsText:
3/4 cup sugar
1/2 cup oil
2 eggs
2 cups flour
1 teaspoon cream of tartar
1/2 teaspoon soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla
Filling (make double)
2 cup ground raisins
1/4 cup sugar
1 cup water

name: Flaky Pie Crust Mix (for freezer)
ingredientsText:
12 1/2 cups all purpose flour
2 tablespoon salt
5 cups white crisco vegetable shortening

1/2 batch
makes 3 double crusts
6 1/4 cups flour
1 tablespoons salt
2 1/2 cups shortening

Flaky pie crust from mix
2 1/2 cups flaky pie crust mix
1/4 cup ice water
1 egg beaten
1 tablespoon white vinegar
preparationText:
Combine flour and salt in a large mixing bowl. Mix well. With a pastry blender, cut in shortening until evenly distributed. Mixture will resemble cornmeal in texture with pea sized lumps.  Put in a large airtight zip-loc bag. Label. Store in freezer.  Use within 10-12 months.

When used:
Crumble flaky pie crust mix if frozen.  Put mix in a medium bowl.  In a small bowl, beat egg, add ice water and vinegar.  Add liquid mixture to dry mixture in tablespoons and toss with fork until dough clings together.  Roll out dough to desired thickness on floured bread board.  Place dough in pie tins without stretching.  Flute edges as desired.  If filling recipe calls for baked pie crust, preheat oven to 425 degrees.  Prick pie crust with fork tines to alleviate air bubbles.  Bake 10-12 minutes, until lightly browned. Cool. Makes enough for one 9" double-crust pie, or two 9" single-crust pies.

name: Fluffy Pancakes
ingredientsText:
3/4 cup milk
2 tablespoons white vinegar
1 cup all-purpose flour
2 tablespoons white sugar
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 egg
2 tablespoons butter, melted
preparationText:
1. Combine milk with vinegar in a medium bowl and set aside for 5 minutes to "sour".
2. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large mixing bowl. Whisk egg and butter into "soured" milk. Pour the flour mixture into the wet ingredients and whisk until lumps are gone.
3. Heat a large skillet over medium heat, and coat with cooking spray. Pour 1/4 cupfuls of batter onto the skillet, and cook until bubbles appear on the surface. Flip with a spatula, and cook until browned on the other side.
4. PREP 10 mins
5. COOK 10 mins
6. READY IN 25 mins

name: Fortune Cookies
ingredientsText:
Nonstick spray
2 egg whites
1/2 cup all-purpose flour, sifted
1 1/2 tsp corn starch
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 teaspoon almond extract
1/2 teaspoon vanilla flavoring
3 Tbsp oil
3 teaspoons water
Pinch salt
Fortunes written on strips of colored paper
Special equipment: silpat
preparationText:
1. Cook's Note: using a silpat makes it easier to remove the cookies from the sheet tray.
2. Blend egg whites extract and oil til fluffy.
3. Add flour corn starch sugar salt and water
4. Beat til smooth
5. Bake at 300 F 1 Tbsp per cookie, smooth out with spoon

name: Fresh Peach Pie
ingredientsText:
1 cup sugar
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1 cup water
1 package (3 ounces) peach or orange gelatin
3 cups sliced peeled ripe peaches
1 pastry shell (9 inches), baked
whipped cream, optional
preparationText:
In a saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch and water until smooth. Cook and stir over medium heat until bubbly and thickened. Remove from the heat; stir in gelatin until dissolved. Cool.
Arrange peaches in crust; pour filling over peaches. Chill for 2 hours or until set. Serve with whipped cream if desired.

name: Fresh Peach Pie
ingredientsText:
1 cup sugar
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1 cup water
1 package (3 ounces) peach jello
3 cups sliced peeled ripe peaches
1 pastry shell (9 inches), baked
Whipped cream, optional
preparationText:
In a saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch and water until smooth. Cook and stir over medium heat until bubbly and thickened. Remove from the heat; stir in gelatin until dissolved. Cool.

Arrange peaches in crust; pour filling over peaches. Chill for 2 hours or until set. Serve with whipped cream if desired.

name: Fresh Peach Pie
ingredientsText:
Filling:
1 c. water
1 c. sugar
4 Tb cornstarch
2 Tb lemon juice
¼ c. butter
4 sliced peaches
Pie Crust:
12 Tbs (1 1/2 sticks) very cold unsalted butter
3 cups all-purpose flour
1 tsp salt
1 Tbs sugar
1/3 cup very cold shortening
6 Tbs (about 1/2 cup) ice water
preparationText:
Combine water, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, and butter and cook until thickened. Cool. Add peaches and put in pre-cooked pie crust.
Dice the butter and return it to the refrigerator while you prepare the flour mixture. Place the flour, salt, and sugar in the bowl of a food processor fitted with a steel blade and pulse a few times to mix. Add the butter and shortening. Pulse 8-12 times, until the butter is the size of peas. With the machine running, pour the ice water down the feed tube and pulse the machine until the dough begins to form a ball. Dump out onto a floured board and roll into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Cut the dough in half. Roll each piece on a well-floured board into a circle, rolling for the center to the edge, turning and flouring the dough to make sure it doesn’t stick to the board. Fold the dough in half, place in a pie pan, and unfold to fit the pan. Repeat with the top crust.

name: Frosted Orange Date Bar
ingredientsText:
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 cup butter
1/2 cup water
1 cup (8 ounce package dates)

1 1/4 cups flour
1 cup nuts (optional)
3/4 cups milk
2 eggs
3/4 teaspoon soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 cup orange juice
1 Tablespoon grated orange rind

Frosting:
3 cups powdered sugar
1/2 cup butter
3 ounces cream cheese
1 tablespoon grated orange peel
Orange juice to make the right consistency.
preparationText: combine sugar, butter, water dates.  Boil 5 to 8 minutes.  Add remaining ingredients.

name: Fruit Ice Cream
ingredientsText:
4 eggs
3 cups sugar
4 cups fruit
1/2 cup lemon jice
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 quart cream
2 cups milk
preparationText:
Enter Directions
Combine all ingredients except milk in blender.  Process 20 seconds until smooth.  Add milk to fill line on freezer.  Freeze.  Wala.

name: Fruit Pizza
ingredientsText:
1 tube (16-1/2 ounces) refrigerated sugar cookie dough
1 package (8 ounces)
1/4 cup confectioners' sugar
1 carton (8 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed
2 to 3 kiwifruit, peeled and thinly sliced
1 to 2 firm bananas, sliced
1 can (11 ounces) mandarin oranges, drained
1/2 cup red grape halves
1/4 cup sugar
1/4 cup orange juice
2 tablespoons water
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1-1/2 teaspoons cornstarch
Pinch salt
preparationText:
Pat cookie dough into an ungreased 14-in. pizza pan. Bake at 350° for 15-18 minutes or until deep golden brown; cool.

In a bowl, beat the cream cheese and confectioners' sugar until smooth. Fold in whipped topping. Spread over crust. Arrange fruit on top.

In a saucepan, bring the sugar, orange juice, water, lemon juice, cornstarch and salt to a boil, stirring constantly for 2 minutes or until thickened. Cool; brush over fruit. Chill. Store in refrigerator.

name: Fruit Pizza Topping
ingredientsText:
8 ounce cream cheese
1 tablespoon almond or vanilla extract
1/2 cup whipped cream (already whipped)
2 tablespoons sugar
apple jelly or peach jelly
preparationText:
Beat cream cheese flavor and sugar, add whipped cream.
Spread jelly.
Arrange fruit.



Spread on a sugar cookie crust.

name: German Chocolate Pie
ingredientsText:
1 ounce German sweet chocolate, chopped
2 tablespoons butter, cubed
1 can (12 ounces) evaporated milk
1-1/2 cups sugar
3 tablespoons cornstarch
1/8 teaspoon salt
2 eggs, lightly beaten
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 unbaked deep-dish pastry shell (9 inches)
1/2 cup chopped pecans
1-1/3 cups flaked coconut
preparationText:
In a microwave, melt chocolate and butter; stir until smooth. Gradually add milk; set aside.

In a large bowl, combine the sugar, cornstarch and salt. Stir in eggs and vanilla. Gradually stir in chocolate mixture. Pour into pastry shell.

Combine pecans and coconut; sprinkle over filling. Bake at 375° for 45-50 minutes or until puffed and browned.

Cool for 4 hours. Chill until serving (filling will become firm as it cools).

name: Ginger Bread
ingredientsText:
1 cup Walnuts; Opt. toasted and ground
6 cups Whole-wheat flour
2 teaspoons Salt
6 teaspoons Baking soda
8 teaspoons Ginger
4 teaspoons Cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon Nutmeg
1/2 teaspoon Cloves
2 cup Granulated sugar
1 cup Oil
8 Eggs
4 teaspoons Vanilla
4 cups Applesauce; unsweetened
preparationText: No instructions written.

name: Gingerbread Cake with Lemon Sauce
ingredientsText:
Gingerbread:
1/2 cup Sugar
4 tablespoons Butter softened
1 cup Flour
1 teaspoon ground Ginger
1 teaspoon ground Cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon ground Allspice
1/2 teaspoon Salt
1/2 teaspoon Baking Soda
1/2 cup nonfat plain Yogurt or Buttermilk
1/4 cup light Molasses
1 Egg slightly beaten

Lemon sauce:
1/2 cup Sugar
4 tablespoons unsalted Butter
2 tablespoons fresh Lemon juice
1 teaspoon Lemon zest
1/4 cup Water
Strips of Lemon peel for garnish
preparationText:
To make gingerbread:
Preheat oven to 375 F.  Lightly grease and 8-inch square or round cake pan.  In a large bowl, cream together sugar and butter.  

In another bowl, mix flour ginger, cinnamon, allspice, and salt.  Blend into the creamed ingredients until the mixture resembles moist crumbs.  Transfer a third of the mixture to another bowl and reserve.

To the remaining mixture, add baking soda, yogurt, molasses, and egg.  Stir until the batter is evenly blended.  Pour into prepared pan.  Sprinkle evenly with reserved batter.  Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.  

Lemon Sauce:
In a small saucepan, combine sugar, butter, lemon juice, zest, and water.  Place over medium heat and bring to a boil, stirring constantly.  Reduce heat to low and simmer for 4 minutes, stirring until the mixture is clear and slightly thickened.  Serve warm over gingerbread cake.  Top with strips o  f lemon peel if desired.

name: Gingersnaps
ingredientsText:
3/4 Cups Butter
1 Cup Sugar
1/4 Cup Molasses
1 Egg
2 Cups Flour
1/4 Teaspoon Salt
2 teaspoon Baking soda
1 teaspoon Cinnamon
1 teaspoon Cloves
1 teaspoon Ginger
preparationText: Preheat oven to 350. Cream Butter, sugar, molasses, and egg. Combine dry ingredients in another bowl. Pour dry ingredients into butter mixture. Roll into balls and roll in sugar. Bake for ten minutes.

name: Gluten Free Carrot Cake Recipe
ingredientsText:
2 cups gluten free flour
3 teaspoons baking powder
1 3/4 teaspoons baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon cinnamon
2 cups sugar
3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons corn oil
4 eggs slightly beaten
1 tablespoon mayonaise
2 cups grated carrots
1/2 cup chopped walnuts
8 1/2 ounces crushed pineapple with juice

Cream Cheese Frosting
1/2 cups butter softened
8 ounces cream cheese softened
2 cups confectioner's sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
preparationText:
1. Preheat oven to 350 F and grease a 9" x 13" baking pan.  In a large bowl sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Add the sugar, corn oil, eggs, and mayonaise. Stir well. Stir in the carrots, nuts, and cheese frosting.  Makes 18 3 x 2 1/4 inch servings
2. Frosting:  Whip all ingredients together until fluffy.  If the frosting is too thick add a few drops of milk.

name: Golden Graham Treats
ingredientsText:
6 cups miniature marshmallows (one 10 oz bag)
1 1/2 cups Hershey's Milk chocolate chips.
5 tablespoons butter or margarine
1 teaspoon vanilla
8 cups Golden Grahams cereal (one 13 oz. box)
preparationText: Melt 5 cups marshmallows (save one cup marshmallows for later), milk chocolate chips and butter in 3-quart saucepan over low heat, stirring occasionally.  Romove from heat.  stir in vanilla, Butter rectangular pan, 13" x 9", x 2".

name: Gone with the Wind Pudding
ingredientsText:
1 six ounce package of lemon jello dissolved in 3 cups hot water.  Cool then add:
1 cup sugar
1/2 cup fresh lemon juice (2 lemons)
1 can sego milk or 2 cups cream
1 tablespoon vanilla.
graham cracker crumbs
preparationText: When jello starts to set whip until frothy.  Fold in 1 can sego milk whipped, or 2 cups cream whipped. Cover bottom of dish (9 x 13) with graham cracker crumbs, pour in jello mix. Top with crumbs.

name: Grandmas Cookie Jar Oatmeal Cookies
ingredientsText:
2 cups Brown sugar
3 cups Oats
1 3/4 cups Flour
1/2 teaspoon Salt
1 teaspoon Cinnamon
1 teaspoon Baking soda
1 cup Butter
2 Eggs
2 teaspoon Vanilla
1 1/2 cups Raisins
preparationText: Preheat oven to 350F. Cream brown sugar, butter, eggs, and vanilla. In another bowl combine dry ingredients. Add dry ingredients to the butter mixture. Add raisins to the dough. Roll into balls and bake for 10 minutes.

name: Grands! Monkey Bread
ingredientsText:
1/2 cup granulated sugar
1 teaspoon cinnamon
2 cans (16.3 oz each) PillsburyÃ‚® Grands!Ã‚® Homestyle refrigerated buttermilk biscuits
1/2 cup chopped walnuts, if desired
1/2 cup raisins, if desired
1 cup firmly packed brown sugar
3/4 cup butter or margarine, melted
preparationText:
1 Heat oven to 350°F. Lightly grease 12-cup fluted tube pan with shortening or cooking spray. In large -storage plastic food bag, mix granulated sugar and cinnamon.

2 Separate dough into 16 biscuits; cut each into quarters. Shake in bag to coat. Arrange in pan, adding walnuts and raisins among the biscuit pieces.

3 In small bowl, mix brown sugar and butter; pour over biscuit pieces.

4 Bake 28 to 32 minutes or until golden brown and no longer doughy in center. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Turn upside down onto serving plate; pull apart to serve. Serve warm.

name: Ham and Asparagus
ingredientsText:
4 oz dried med. Shell macaroni
12 oz asparagus 1in. Pieces
2 tbsp. Butter
8 oz chopped ham
1 c chopped onion
6 cloves garlic minced
2 tbl. Flour
13/4 c whole milk
2 tbl. Pamesan
1 tbl lemon peel
preparationText:
Cook Mac add asparagus in last 2 min. Drain,set aside.
Melt butter,add ham,brown,add onion, garlic. Cook  and stir 3min. More.  Add flour stir to coat. Add milk. Cook and stir until thick and bubbly, cook 1min more. Stir in macaroni,asparagus,parmesan, and lemonpeel, heat through.  Makes 4servings.  BHG.com/10Asparagus

name: Heiners Donuts
ingredientsText:
7 cup flour
2 tablespoon yeast
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 cup Shortening
1 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
1 cup mashed potatoes
1 cup potato water
1 cup milk
preparationText: (Double Recipe) Blend mashed potatoes and potato water in blender. Rise one , double in size, roll out 1/2" make doughnuts and rise again.  Fry at 375° F.

name: Honey Mustard Marinade
ingredientsText:
1/4 cup oil
2 tablespoons lemon juice
2 tablespoons brown sugar
2 tablespoons honey
2 tablespoons dijon mustard
2 teaspoons chicken bullion granules
preparationText: Try marinating your pork chops in a honey mustard sauce and then baking or grilling. This recipe is enough for 3 large chops

name: Ice Cream in a Bag
ingredientsText:
1 Tablespoon sugar
1/2 cup milk or half and half
1/4 tsp. vanilla
(put in pint size ziplock)
6 Tablespoons rock salt
crushed ice.
preparationText: In a 1 gallon ziplock fill bag 1/2 full of ice.  Add salt. Squish between hands until ice cream freezes. It will be soft set.  Eat immediately.

name: Lemon Blueberry Muffins
ingredientsText:
1/2 cup Butter
1 cup Granulated sugar
2 Eggs
1/2 cup Milk
2 tablespoon Lemon Juice
2 teaspoon Lemon zest
2 cup Flour
2 teaspoon Baking powder
dash Salt
2 cups Blueberries; fresh or frozen
Glaze
1 1/2 cups Powdered sugar
2 tablespoons Lemon Juice
1 teaspoon Butter; melted
1/4 teaspoon Vanilla
preparationText:
Cream butter and sugar till fluffy.  Add eggs one at a time beating after each addition.  Add milk lemon juice and zest.  Combine dry ingredients and add to wet until just moistened.  Fold in blueberries.


Bake at 400 F for 20-30 mins.  


Glaze:  Mix glaze ingredients until smooth.  Drizzle over warm muffins.

name: Lemon Bread
ingredientsText:
1/2 cup butter/oil
3/4 cup Granulated sugar; 1/4 c. for sauce
3 lemons; juiced
1 1/2 tablespoon lemon zest
3 eggs
1 1/4 cup flour
2 teaspoon Baking powder
1/3 cup milk
preparationText:
Bake 350 F for 45 min.


Heat juice, sugar. to dissolve pour over hot cake.

name: Marbled Chocolate Bar
ingredientsText:
1 package German chocolate cake mix
8 ounces cream cheese softened
1/2 cup sugar
3/4 cup chocolate chips
preparationText: Mix cake as package directs. pour into 15x10x1 pan. Mix cream cheese, sugar, and 1/4 cup chocolate chips. Drop by tablespoons on cake then sprinkle remaining chocolate chips on top. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

name: Marbled Chocolate Cheesecake Bars
ingredientsText:
3/4 cup water
1/2 cup butter
1-1/2 ounces unsweetened chocolate
2 cups all-purpose flour
1-1/2 cups packed brown sugar
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
1/2 cup sour cream
1 package (8 ounces)
1/3 cup sugar
1 egg, beaten
1 tablespoon vanilla extract
1 cup (6 ounces) semisweet chocolate chips
preparationText:
In a small saucepan, combine the water, butter and chocolate; cook and stir over low heat until smooth. Cool.

In a large bowl, combine the flour, brown sugar, baking soda and salt. Add eggs and sour cream; beat on low speed just until combined. Stir in chocolate mixture until smooth.

In another bowl, beat the cream cheese, sugar, egg and vanilla; set aside. Spread chocolate batter into a greased 15-in. x 10-in. x 1-in. baking pan. Drop cream cheese mixture by tablespoonfuls over batter; cut through the batter with a knife to swirl. Sprinkle with chocolate chips.

Bake at 375° for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Cut into bars.

name: Maureen's Cheesecake
ingredientsText:
3 Tablespoons butter
1 Tablespoon sugar
1 cup graham cracker crumbs
Melt at 300 degrees. Then add sugar and graham crackers. Press firmly into pan. Bake 20 minutes.

4 eggs
1 cup sugar
16 ounces cream cheese, softened.
1 tsp. Vanilla.
preparationText:
In mixing bowl beat eggs 3 minutes. Add sugar and beat 2 minutes.  Add cream cheese slowly.  Add vanilla and beat ten minutes.  Pur into pan.  Bake at 325 degrees for 50-60 minutes (or until firmly set).

Not necessary, but adds extra flavor:
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 tsp vanilla
1 16 ounce carton sour cream.  Add sugar and vanilla to sour cream, then set aside to get room temperature.
While cake is warm spread on sour cream mixture then bake 10-12 minutes.  Take out and cool on counter for 30 minutes and put in refrigerator. until cold.

name: Microwave Caramel Popcorn
ingredientsText:
1/2 cup Butter
1/2 Brown Sugar
1/4 cup Karo syrup
1/4 teaspoon Salt
1/2 teaspoon Vanilla
1/4 teaspoon Baking Soda
4 quarts Popcorn popped
preparationText: Microwave butter, brown sugar, karo, and salt on high for 4 minutes until boiling.  Stir 3 times.  Add vanilla and baking soda to sauce.   Put popcorn in a brown paper bag, and pour sauce on top.  Microwave for 1 1/2 mins.  Shake.  Microwave for 15 seconds more.

name: New York Special Ice Cream
ingredientsText:
Cooked custard
1/2 gallon milk (only use one quart for custard, and rest at the end)
6 eggs
2 3/4 cups sugar
2 level tablespoons flour
pinch salt
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 pint whipping cream
preparationText:
Double boiler
Heat milk until bubbling.  beat eggs. Add sugar and flour and salt to eggs.  Add egg mix to milk until starts to bubble again.  Set aside, cool.  Add cream and vanilla for vanilla ice cream. 
For New York Special variation add a small jar of maraschino cherries chopped up, 1/2 cup walnuts chopped, 1 scant teaspoon almond extract

name: Oatmeal Bars (No Bake)
ingredientsText:
1/2 cup butter
1/2 cup packed brown sugar
1 teaspoon grated orange peel
1/2 cup orange juice
2 tablespoons wheat germ
2 cups quick-cooking rolled oats
1 cup toasted flaked coconut
1/2 cup chopped nuts
1/2 cup sesame seeds
preparationText: Melt butter or margarine in saucepan. Add brown sugar, orange peel, orange juice. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add what germ, rolled oats, coconut, nuts and sesame seeds. Spread in 9 inch square pan and refrigerate until hard. Cut into squares. Makes 36 bars.

name: Old Fashioned Tapioca Pudding
ingredientsText:
1/3 cup tapioca
3/4 cup water
1/4 to 1/2 teaspoons vanilla
2 1/4 cups milk
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
1/2 cup sugar
preparationText: Soak tapioca in water for at least three hours in a 1 1/2 quart pan. Add milk and salt to soaked tapioca, beat egg yolks and mix in.  Stir until boiling.  Simmer, uncovered, over very low heat for 50 minutes. Stir now and then. Beat egg whites with sugar, mix in some of the ot tapioca.  Return all to pan, stir 3 minutes over low heat.  Cool 15 minutes.  Add vanilla. Serve warm or chilled, plain or with fruits, nutmeg or coconut mixed in.  Makes 3 1/2 cups.

name: Orange Nut Bread
ingredientsText:
1 Medium orange
1 cup raisins or dates
4 tablespoons melted butter/margarine
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 egg, beaten
2 cups flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 cup sugar
1 cup chopped nuts
preparationText: Squeeze orange for juice. Pour juice into 1-cup measure and fill with boiling water. Put orange rind and raisins through chopper. Combine butter, vanilla, egg, and juice with chopped fruits. Add dry ingredients, then nuts. Bake at 350° F for 1 hour.

name: Overnight French Toast
ingredientsText:
1 loaf (1 pound) unsliced cinnamon-raisin bread
5 eggs
2 egg yolks
1 cup half-and-half cream
3/4 cup packed brown sugar
2 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice
1 teaspoon maple flavoring
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
3 cups milk
1/4 cup butter, melted
Fresh strawberries
preparationText:
Slice ends from bread and discard or save for another use. Slice remaining loaf into eight 1-in. slices and arrange in the bottom of two greased 8-in. square baking pans.

In a large bowl, beat the eggs, yolks, cream, brown sugar, pie spice and flavorings. Gradually add milk, beating until well blended; pour over bread. Cover and chill overnight.

Remove from the refrigerator 30 minutes before baking.

Drizzle with butter. Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 45-60 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Serve warm; top with strawberries or syrup if desired.

Editor's Note: If cinnamon-raisin bread is unavailable, substitute raisin bread and add 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon to the egg mixture.

name: Peanut Brittle
ingredientsText:
2 cups Sugar
1 cup Corn syrup
1/2 cup water
1/4 teaspoon Salt
2 tablespoons of Butter
2 1/2 cups Raw Peanuts
2 teaspoons Vanilla
1 teaspoon Baking Soda
preparationText: Mix sugar, corn syrup, water, salt, and butter together.  Cover and bring to boiling point slowly!  When boiling remove cover.  When it reaches soft ball stage, add peanuts.  Stir frequently to prevent scorching.  Cook to hard crack stage.  Mixture should smoke and should be a deep caramel color.  Remove and quickly stir in soda and vanilla.  Pour out on two buttered sheets.  Using two forks pull and stretch candy.

name: Pecan Pie
ingredientsText:
1 sheet refrigerated pie pastry
1/2 cup butter, softened
1 cup sugar
3 eggs
3/4 cup light corn syrup
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup Pecan halves
preparationText:
Unroll pastry into a 9-in. pie plate; flute edges. In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs, corn syrup and vanilla. Pour into pastry shell; arrange pecans over top.

Bake at 375° for 50-55 minutes or until set. Cover edges with foil during the last 15 minutes to prevent overbrowning if necessary. Cool on a wire rack. Refrigerate leftovers.

name: Pepperkaker
ingredientsText:
4 cups all-purpose flour
1 1/3 cups sugar
1/4 cup corn syrup
1/3 cup water
7/8 cup butter
1 Tablespoon orange zest grated
1 Tablespoon cinnamon
1/2 Tablespoon ginger
1/2 Tablespoon ground cloves
2 teaspoons ground cardamom
2 teaspoons baking soda
preparationText: Boil sugar, syrup, and water in a small saucepan. Put the butter and spices in a large mixing bowl. Pour in the hot sugar mixture. Stir until butter has melted. COOL. Stir together baking soda and flour. Mix all ingredients together to make a smooth dough. Cover and let stand overnight. Roll out one porting of the dough at a time, with a light tough. Cut out shapes from the dough with cookie cutters. Place the cookies on cold, greased cookie sheets. Bake the cookies at 400F for 5-8 minutes in the center of the oven. Check often as they burn easily.

name: Peppermint candy fudge
ingredientsText:
2 1/2 c. sugar
1/2 c. butter
5 oz. can (2/3 c.) evaporated milk
7 oz. jar (2 c.) marshmallow creme
8 oz. almond bark
1/2 c. finely crushed peppermint candy
Red food coloring
preparationText:
Line 9-inch square of 9x13 inch pan with foil so that foil extends over sides of pan; butter foil.
In large saucepan, combine sugar, butter and milk. Bring to boil, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Add marshmallow creme and almond bark; blend until smooth. Stir in peppermint candy. Add desired amount of red food coloring. Pour into prepared pan.

Cool to room temperature. Score fudge into 36 or 48 squares. Put crushed peppermint candy on top of fudge. Refrigerate until firm. Remove fudge from pan by lifting foil; remove foil from fudge. Using large knife, cut through scored lines. Store in refrigerator. Makes about 2 1/2 pounds.

name: Perfect Rhubarb Pie
ingredientsText:
4 cups sliced fresh
4 cups boiling water
1-1/2 cups sugar
3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon quick-cooking tapioca
1 egg
2 teaspoons cold water
Pastry for double-crust pie (9 inches)
1 tablespoon butter
preparationText:
Place rhubarb in a colander; pour boiling water over rhubarb and allow to drain. In a large bowl, mix sugar, flour and tapioca. Add drained rhubarb; toss to coat. Let stand 15 minutes. In a small bowl, whisk egg and cold water; stir into rhubarb mixture.

Preheat oven to 400°. On a lightly floured surface, roll one half of the pastry dough to a 1/8-in.-thick circle; transfer to a 9-in. pie plate. Trim pastry even with rim. Add filling; dot with butter. Roll remaining dough to a 1/8-in.-thick circle. Place over filling. Trim, seal and flute edge. Cut slits in top. Bake 15 minutes.

Reduce oven setting to 350°. Bake 40-50 minutes longer or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly. Cool on a wire rack.

Editor's Note: If using frozen rhubarb, measure rhubarb while still frozen, then thaw completely. Drain in a colander, but do not press liquid out. Pastry for double-crust pie (9 inches): Combine 2-1/2 cups all-purpose flour and 1/2 tsp. salt; cut in 1 cup cold butter until crumbly. Gradually add 1/3 to 2/3 cup ice water, tossing with a fork until dough holds together when pressed. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate 1 hour.

name: Pineapple Bran Muffins
ingredientsText:
2 cups All Bran Cereal
2 cups Buttermilk
2 eggs
19 ounces Pineapple
1/2 cup oil or butter
2 1/2 cups flour
3/4 cup Brown sugar
2 teaspoons salt
2 teaspoons Baking soda
1 cup Almonds; toasted, chopped
preparationText: Combine All Bran and Buttermilk. Set aside for 5 minutes. Add other liquids then dry ingredients. Can store 2-3 weeks in refrigerator.

name: Pineapple Coconut delights
ingredientsText:
1 1/2 cup flour
1 teaspoon Baking powder
1/2 teaspoon soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 cup oil
1/2 cup sugar
1 egg
1 cup sour cream
1 cup crushed pineapple
preparationText: Don't Know

name: Pizza Dough
ingredientsText:
1 1/2 tablespoon yeast
1 1/2 teaspoon Granulated sugar
1 1/2 teaspoon Salt
3 tablespoons Oil
3 cups All purpose flour
1 1/2 cups Hot water
preparationText: Put in bowl covered with dish towel. Place in microwave with 1 cup of water in a pint jar. Cook for 10 minutes on power level 1.

name: Play Dough
ingredientsText:
1 cup flour
1/2 cup salt
1 cup water
1 tablespoon oil
2 teaspoons cream of tarter
food coloring

name: Pork Chops with Cranberries
ingredientsText:
1-1/2 cups sugar
1-3/4 cups water,
1 package (12 ounces) fresh
1/2 cup barbecue sauce
8 bone-in pork loin chops (1/2 to 3/4 inch thick and 8 ounces
Salt and pepper to taste
2 tablespoons canola oil
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1/4 cup cold water
preparationText:
In a large saucepan, combine sugar and 1-1/2 cups water. Cook and stir over medium heat until the sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil; boil, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Add cranberries; cook 5 minutes longer or until the berries pop. Skim off foam if necessary. Stir in barbecue sauce and remaining water; set aside.

Season pork chops with salt and pepper. In a large skillet over medium heat, brown chops on both sides in oil; drain. Pour the cranberry sauce over chops. Cover and simmer for 35-40 minutes or until a meat thermometer reads 160°. Remove chops and keep warm.

Combine cornstarch and cold water until smooth; add to skillet. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Serve with pork chops.

Editor's Note: One 16-ounce can of whole-berry cranberry sauce may be substituted for the sugar, cranberries and 1-1/2 cups water. Combine cranberry sauce with the barbecue sauce and 1/4 cup water; use as directed in recipes.

name: Prize cookies
ingredientsText:
1 cup shortening
1 1/2 cups sugar
3 eggs
3 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
9 ounces condensed mincemeat, crumbled.
Quick Frosting (optional, recipe follows)
preparationText:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees . In large bowl, beat shortening and sugar until fluffy. Add eggs; beat well. Stir together dry ingredients. Gradually add to shortening mixture; mix well. Stir in mincemeat.
2. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls, 2 inches apart, onto greased baking sheets.  Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned.   Cool. Frost with quick frosting (optional).
Quick frosting:  In a small bowl beat
3 cups confectioners sugar, 3 tablespoons water until well blended.
Tip: For cake-like cookies, substitute 1 1/3 cups (one half 27 ounce jar). None Such Ready to use Mincemeat (Regular or Brandy & Rum) for condensed mincemeat.

name: Pull-Apart Morning Rolls
ingredientsText:
1 cup chopped nuts
1 package (3.4 ounces) instant butterscotch pudding mix
1/2 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
2 packages (13-1/2 to 15 ounces
1/2 cup butter, melted
preparationText:
Sprinkle walnuts in the bottom of a well-greased 10-in. fluted tube pan. Combine pudding mix, brown sugar and cinnamon. Roll each dinner roll in butter and then in brown sugar mixture; coat well. Place each roll in pan. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove from refrigerator 30 minutes before baking.

Bake at 350° for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 10 minutes in pan before removing to a serving platter.

name: Pumpkin Bars
ingredientsText:
2 cups Flour
4 Eggs
2 cups Sugar
1 cup Oil
1 teaspoon Baking soda
2 cups Pumpkin
2 teaspoons Baking Powder
1/2 teaspoon Salt
2 teaspoons Cinnamon
preparationText: Mix together sugar, eggs, pumpkin, and oil. Sift dry ingredients together and add to pumpkin mixture. Stir in 1 tsp. cinnamon, 1 cup nuts, 1tsp. Vanilla. Pour into greased floured jelly roll pan. Bake at 350F for 40-45 Minutes. Spread with Cream Cheese Frosting.

name: Pumpkin Bread
ingredientsText:
1-2/3 cups all-purpose flour
1-1/2 cups sugar
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
3/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
21 cup canned pumpkin
1/2 cup canola oil
1/2 cup water
1/2 cup chopped walnuts
1/2 cup raisins, optional
preparationText:
In a large small bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking soda cinnamon, salt, baking powder, nutmeg and cloves. In a small bowl, whisk the eggs, pumpkin, oil, and water. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Fold in walnuts and raisins if desired.

Pour into a greased 9-in. x 5-in. loaf pan. Bake at 350° for 65-70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack.

name: Pumpkin Muffins
ingredientsText:
14 oz. can Pumpkin
4 Eggs
1 1/2 cup Granulated sugar
1 1/2 cup Oil
3 cup Flour
3 teaspoons Pumpkin Pie Spice
2 teaspoons Baking soda
1 teaspoon Salt
1 cup Raisins
preparationText:
Mix wet ingredients together.  In separate bowl mix dry ingredients together.  Combine wet and dry ingredients until just moistened.  


Bake at 350 F for 18-20 mins.


Notes:  Sugar can be reduced to 3/4 cup.  Oil can be reduced to 3/4 cup plus 1/2 cup applesauce.

name: Pumpkin Pancakes
ingredientsText:
3/4 cup apple cider
1/2 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 cup corn syrup
2 tablespoons butter
1/2 teaspoon lemon juice
1/8 teaspoon ground
1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1 cup all-purpose flour
1 tablespoon sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon ground
2 eggs,
1 cup milk
1/2 cup canned pumpkin
2 tablespoons canola oil
preparationText:
In a large saucepan, combine the syrup ingredients. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 20-25 minutes or until slightly thickened. Let stand for 30 minutes before serving.    For pancakes, in a large bowl,combine the dry ingredients In another bowl, whisk the egg yolks, milk, pumpkin and oil until smooth. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. In a small bowl, beat the egg whites until soft peaks form; fold into batter.    Pour batter by 1/4 cupfuls onto a hot greased griddle. Turn when bubbles form on top of pancakes. Cook until second side is golden brown. Serve with syrup. Yield: 15 pancakes (1 cup syrup).    Originally published as Pumpkin Pancakes in Taste of Home October/November 2001, p39       Nutritional Facts   1 serving (3 each) equals 448 calories, 14 g fat (5 g saturated fat), 104 mg cholesterol, 544 mg sodium, 77 g carbohydrate, 1 g fiber, 7 g protein. 

     Print   Add to Recipe Box

name: Pumpkin Pie Bars
ingredientsText:
1 yellow cake mix
1/2 cup melted butter
4 eggs
3 cups pumpkin
1 cup sugar
1/2 cup packed light brown sugar
2/3 cup evaporated milk
1 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 cup chopped nuts
1/4 cup margarine
preparationText:
Remove 1 cup cake mix, reserve. Grease and flour a 13- x 9-inch pan. 

 In small bowl, lightly beat 1 egg. In large bowl, stir remaining cake mix, melted butter and beaten egg. Press into pan. 

 In large bowl, beat remaining eggs. Stir in pumpkin, 1/2 cup sugar, brown sugar, milk and cinnamon. Pour over cake mixture in pan. 

 To the reserved cake mix, add the remaining 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 margarine and nuts. Mix until crumbly. Sprinkle over pumpkin mixture. 

 Bake at 350 degrees F for 50-60 minutes.

name: Pumpkin Pie Spice
ingredientsText:
1/2 teaspoon Cinnamon
1/8 teaspoon Clove
1/4 teaspoon Ginger
1/8 teaspoon Nutmeg
preparationText: Mix all ingredients together.

name: Pumpkin Soup
ingredientsText:
6 cups chicken stock
1 1/2 teaspoons salt
3 1/2 cups cubed fresh pumpkin
1 teaspoon fresh parsley
1 cup chopped onion
1/2 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme
1 clove garlic, minced
1/2 cup heavy whipping cream
5 whole black peppercorns
preparationText:
1. Cut pumpkin into 1/2-inch cubes.

2. Heat stock, salt, pumpkin, onion, thyme, garlic, and peppercorns. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 30 minutes uncovered.

3. Puree the soup in small batches (1 cup at a time) using a food processor or blender.

4. Return to pan and bring to a boil again. Reduce heat to low and simmer for another 30 minutes, uncovered. Stir in heavy cream. Pour into soup bowls and garnish with fresh parsley.

name: Pumpkin pie bars
ingredientsText:
CRUST:
1 c. flour
1/2 c. quick oats
1/2 c. brown sugar
1/2 c. butter
TOPPING:
1/2 c. nuts, chopped
1/2 c. brown sugar
2 tbsp. butter
FILLING:
2 c. pumpkin
1/2 tsp. salt
1 (13 1/2 oz.) can evaporated milk
2 eggs
3/4 c. sugar
1 tsp. cinnamon
1/2 tsp. ginger
1/4 tsp. cloves
preparationText: Combine first 4 ingredients; mix until crumbly, using electric mixer on low. Press into 13 x 9 x 2 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Combine pumpkin, milk, eggs, sugar, salt and spices; beat well. Pour onto crust, bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Combine nuts, 1/2 cup brown sugar and 2 teaspoons butter. Sprinkle over pumpkin filling. Return to oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until filling is set. Let cool. Cut into bars. Top with whipped cream.

name: Raspberry Pretzel Salad
ingredientsText:
2 1/2 cups ground up pretzels
1/2 cup melted margarine or butter
12 ounces Cream cheese
1 1/2 cups powdered sugar
2 cups cool whip
2 cups pineapple juice
1 large package raspberry jello
1 large package raspberries
preparationText: Mix pretzels and butter then put it into a 9x13 and bake for 10 minutes at 350 degrees. Mix cream cheese, powdered sugar and cool whip. Put on top of  cooled pretzels. Heat the pineapple juice and mix in the jello until it dissolves. Add the raspberries, chill the jello and pour over cream cheese mixture.

name: Reeses Peanut Butter Cups
ingredientsText:
1/4 pound Graham Crackers; Crushed finely
1 cup Powdered Sugar
1/2 cup Creamy Peanut Butter
1/2 cup Butter
Chocolate chips; Melted
preparationText: Stir together Graham Cracker Crumbs, Powdered sugar, peanut butter and softened butter. Roll into balls and dip in melted chocolate

name: Rhubarb Cobbler
ingredientsText:
5 cups rhubarb
1 package strawberry jello
1 1/4 cups sugar
1 cup water
1/2 cup margarine (pour most out)
1 cake mix

name: Rhubarb Pie
ingredientsText:
4 cups fresh or frozen Rhubarb
3 Eggs beaten
2 cups Sugar
1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
4 tablespoons Flour
2 tablespoons Milk or cream for fresh
preparationText: Pour rhubarb into a pie crust shell.  Cook at 425-350 F until knife comes out clean.  Approx 45 mins.

name: Rhubarb Strawberry Pie
ingredientsText:
1 pint fresh strawberries
2 cups sliced fresh rhubarb
3/4 cup Brown sugar
1/2 cup white sugar
1 teaspoon grated lemon rind or 1 Tablespoon lemon juice
1/2 cup all-purpose flour
1 layer to form your top pie crust
preparationText: Combine the sugars, flour and lemon; Add the fresh fruit and toss together. Add the mixture to your unbaked pie shill and cover with the second the top crust. Pinch together the edges and bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 50 minutes. Enjoy warm with dollop of vanilla ice cream!

name: Roasted Pumpkin Seeds
ingredientsText:
2 cups of raw Pumpkin seeds
1 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce
3 tablespoons Butter melted
1 teaspoon Salt
preparationText: Rinse seeds, and boil in salt water for 10 minutes.  Dry on towel.  Mix remaining ingredients and coat the pumpkin seeds.  Bake in 350 F oven for 1-2 hours until crisp.

name: Roca Rectangles
ingredientsText:
Saltine Crackers
2 Cubes Butter
1 1/2 cups Milk Chocolate Chips
1 cup Brown Sugar
1 cup Nuts; Finely Chopped
preparationText:
Line a large jelly roll pan that has 1 inch sides with foil Turn up the edges of the foil to make a shallow pan. Spray it with nonstick spray. Pu a single layer of Saltine Crackers on top of foil, cutting them to fit.


In heavy pan combine butter or margarine and brown sugar. Bring to a boil and boil for 3 minutes, stirring as needed. Pour over crackers and cpread to cover. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 7 minutes. Remove from oven, let cool on a cooling rack 5-6 minutes. Turn off oven and leave door open to cool a little.


Sprinkle chocolate chips of top and put ito oven for 1 and a half minutes, the spread sooth. Sprinkle nuts over top. Break into rectangles.

name: S'mores
ingredientsText:
Graham Crackers
Chocolate Chips
Mini Marshmallows
Drizzle with caramel ice cream topping

name: Sandwich Peanut Butter/Chocolate Cookies
ingredientsText:
1 cup butter
2 cup sugar
1/2 cup Karo syrup
2 eggs
2 teaspoon vanilla
4 teaspoon soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
4 cups flour
Chocolate Cookie
1/2 cup cocoa
4 tablespoon flour
1/2 cup sugar
3 1/3 tablespoon butter melted
Peanut Butter Cookie
1/4 cup flour
1 cup peanut butter
preparationText:
Make batter.  Use half of the batter for chocolate cookies and the other half for the peanut butter cookies. For Chocolate cookies add Chocolate cookie ingredients. For Peanut Butter cookies add Peanut Butter ingredients. Roll 1" ball. Roll in sugar. Bake 350 F, 10-11 minutes.
1 chocolate + 1 peanut butter + 1 large marshmallow, Microwave on 50% for 10 seconds.

name: Seven Layer Dip
ingredientsText:
1/2 cup sour cream
1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix
1 (9 ounce) can bean dip
1 large avocado
2 tablespoons lemon juice
1/2 teaspoon garlic salt
1/2 cup sliced black olives
2 large tomatoes, chopped
1 (8 ounce) can jalapeno processed cheese spread
1/2 cup green onions
1 (14.5 ounce) package corn tortilla chips
preparationText:
1. In a small mixing bowl combine the sour cream and taco mix; mix well.

2. Spread bean dip into the bottom of a 9x13 inch clear glass dish. Layer avocado on top of the bean dip. Sprinkle the lemon juice and garlic salt over the mixture. Spread the sour cream mixture over the avocados. Layer the olives over the sour cream, the tomatoes over the olives; spread  the cheese dip and onions over the entire mixture. Serve with tortilla chips for dipping.

name: Single Recipe for Flaky Pie Crust
ingredientsText:
3 cups all purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 1/4 cups white crisco vegetable shortening
1/4 cup ice water
1 egg beaten
1 tablespoon white vinegar
preparationText:
Put flour,salt and crisco into a medium bowl. Cut in shortening.
Beat egg, add ice water and vinegar.  Add liquid mixture to dry mixture in tablespoons and toss with fork until dough clings together.  Roll out dough to desired thickness on floured bread board.  Place dough in pie tins without stretching. Flute edges as desired.  If filling recipe calls for baked pie crust, preheat oven to 425 degrees.  Prick pie crust with fork tines to alleviate air bubbles.  Bake 10 - 12 minutes, until lightly browned.

Hints
1.  Use ice water only--just enough to hold dough together well.
2.  The vinegar adds acidity to keep the gluten from forming--aids in tenderness.
3.  Don't over-work the pie dough. Handle as little as possible.
4. The best pie pans are glass, dull aluminum or dark finished metal.
5. For best results use only Crisco shortening
6. For a richer color (two crust pies), brush dough with milk or beaten egg before baking.

name: Snickerdoodles
ingredientsText:
1 1/2 cup sugar
1 cup butter
2 eggs
2 3/4 cup flour
1/4 tsp salt
1 tsp baking soda
2 tsp cream of tartar
preparationText:
Cream sugar, butter, and eggs.
Add dry ingredients.
Roll into balls, and roll in cinnamon sugar.
Bake at 350 for 8-9 minutes.
Makes 2 1/2 - 3 dozen.

name: Sopapilla Cheesecake Pie
ingredientsText:
2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened
1 cup white sugar
1 teaspoon Mexican vanilla extract
2 (8 ounce) cans refrigerated crescent rolls
3/4 cup white sugar
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/2 cup butter, room temperature
1/4 cup honey
preparationText:
1. Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.
2. Beat the cream cheese with 1 cup of sugar and the vanilla extract in a bowl until smooth.
3. Unroll the cans of crescent roll dough, and use a rolling pin to shape each piece into 9x13 inch rectangles. Press one piece into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. Evenly spread the cream cheese mixture into the baking dish, then cover with the remaining piece of crescent dough. Stir together 3/4 cup of sugar, cinnamon, and butter. Dot the mixture over the top of the cheesecake.
4. Bake in the preheated oven until the crescent dough has puffed and turned golden brown, about 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and drizzle with honey. Cool completely in the pan before cutting into 12 squares.
5. PREP 15 mins
6. COOK 45 mins
7. READY IN 3 hrs

name: Sour Cream Lemon Pie
ingredientsText:
1 cup sugar
3 1/2 tablespoons corn starch
1 tablespoon lemon zest
1/2 cup fresh lemon juice (4 large lemons) 

3 egg yolks--slightly beaten
1 cup milk
1/4 cup butter
1 cup sour cream
preparationText: Combine sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, lemon zest, egg yolks and milk in a heavy sauce pan.  Cook over medium heat until thickened. Remove from heat, stir in butter until melted and cool to room temperature.  Stir in sour cream and pour into pie shell.  Serve with whipping cream.  Garnish with lemon twist.  Makes one 9" pie.

name: Spanish Flan
ingredientsText:
1 cup white sugar
3 eggs
1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk
1 tablespoon vanilla extract
preparationText:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
2. In a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, melt sugar until liquefied and golden in color. Carefully pour hot syrup into a 9 inch round glass baking dish, turning the dish to evenly coat the bottom and sides. Set aside.
3. In a large bowl, beat eggs. Beat in condensed milk, evaporated milk and vanilla until smooth. Pour egg mixture into baking dish. Cover with aluminum foil.
4. Bake in preheated oven 60 minutes. Let cool completely.
5. To serve, carefully invert on serving plate with edges when completely cool.
6. PREP 20 mins
7. COOK 1 hr
8. READY IN 1 hr 20 mins

name: Spicy Southwestern Slaw
ingredientsText:
3 cups shredded cabbage
1 carrot, shredded
1 onion, diced
1 red bell pepper, diced
1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced
1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro
1/2 cup canola oil
2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
1 tablespoon white sugar
1 teaspoon cayenne pepper
salt and pepper to taste
preparationText:
1. In a large bowl, toss together the cabbage, carrot, onion, red pepper, jalapeno and cilantro.  Set aside.

2. In a small bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegar, sugar, cayenne pepper, salt and pepper.  Pour over vegetable mixture and toss to combine.  Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour.

name: Sugarplums Recipe : Alton Brown
ingredientsText:
6 ounces slivered almonds, toasted
4 ounces dried plums
4 ounces dried apricots
4 ounces dried figs
1/4 cup powdered sugar
orange zest lg.
1/2 tsp. cinnamon
1/4 tsp ginger
1/8 teaspoon allspice
Pinch kosher salt
1/4 cup honey
1 cup coarse sugar for rolling
preparationText:
Put the almonds, plums, apricots, and figs into the bowl of a food processor and pulse 20 to 25 times or until the fruit and nuts are chopped into small pieces, but before the mixture becomes a ball. 

	 

	Combine the powdered sugar, anise seeds, fennel seeds, caraway seeds, cardamom, and salt in a medium mixing bowl. Add the nut and fruit mixture and the honey and mix using gloved hands until well combined. 

	 

	Scoop the mixture into 1/4-ounce portions and roll into balls. If serving immediately, roll in the coarse sugar and serve. If not serving immediately, put the balls on a cooling rack and leave uncovered until ready to serve. Roll in the coarse sugar prior to serving. 

	 

	The Sugarplums may be stored on the cooling rack for up to a week. After a week, store in an airtight container for up to a month.

name: Summer Dessert Pizza
ingredientsText:
1/4 cup butter, softened
1/2 cup sugar
1 egg
1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/4 teaspoon lemon extract
1-1/4 cups all-purpose flour
1/4 teaspoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon baking soda
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 cup sugar
2 teaspoons cornstarch
1/4 cup water
1/4 cup orange juice
4 ounces cream cheese, softened
1/4 cup confectioners' sugar
1 cup whipped topping
1 firm banana, sliced
1 cup sliced fresh strawberries
1 can (8 ounces) mandarin oranges, drained
2 kiwifruit, peeled and thinly sliced
1/3 cup fresh blueberries
preparationText:
In a small bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and extracts. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt; add to creamed mixture and beat well. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.

Press dough into a greased 12-in. x 14-in. pizza pan. Bake at 350° for 12-14 minutes or until light golden brown. Cool completely on a wire rack.

For glaze, combine sugar and cornstarch in a small saucepan. Stir in the water and orange juice until smooth. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 1-2 minutes or until thickened. Cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes.

For topping, in a small bowl, beat cream cheese and confectioners' sugar until smooth. Add whipped topping; mix well. Spread over crust. Arrange fruit on top. Brush glaze over fruit. Store in the refrigerator.

name: Taco Soup
ingredientsText:
1 1/2 Lbs Ground Beef
2 Onions Chopped
1/2 cup Celery Chopped
1 garlic clove minced
28 oz. can whole tomatoes, cut up
4.25 oz. can sliced black olives, drained
14 1/2 oz. can green beans drained
15.25 oz. can corn
15 oz. can dark red kidney beans
1 Tbsp. chili powder
Grated Cheddar cheese
preparationText:
1. Brown Ground beef. Reserve drippings and transfer beef to slow cooker.
2. Saute onions, pepper, celery, and garlic in drippings in skillet. Transfer to slow cooker
3. Add remaining ingredients. Mix well.
4. Cover. Cook on high for 3-4 hours
5. Sprinkle individual servings with grated cheese. Serve with tortilla chips

name: The Best Vegetarian Chili in the World
ingredientsText:
1 tablespoon olive oil
1/2 medium onion, chopped
2 bay leaves
1 teaspoon ground cumin
2 tablespoons dried oregano
1 tablespoon salt
2 stalks celery, chopped
2 green bell peppers, chopped
2 jalapeno peppers, chopped
3 cloves garlic, chopped
2 (4 ounce) cans chopped green chile peppers, drained
2 (12 ounce) packages vegetarian burger crumbles
3 (28 ounce) cans whole peeled tomatoes, crushed
1/4 cup chili powder
1 tablespoon ground black pepper
1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, drained
1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans\corn, drained
1 (15 ounce) can black beans
1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn
preparationText:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Stir in the onion, and season with bay leaves, cumin, oregano, and salt. Cook and stir until onion is tender, then mix in the celery, green bell peppers, jalapeno peppers, garlic, and green chile peppers. When vegetables are heated through, mix in the vegetarian burger crumbles. Reduce heat to low, cover pot, and simmer 5 minutes.
2. Mix the tomatoes into the pot. Season chili with chili powder and pepper. Stir in the kidney beans, garbanzo beans, and black beans. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer 45 minutes. Stir in the corn, and continue cooking 5 minutes before serving.
3. PREP 15 mins
4. COOK 1 hr
5. READY IN 1 hr 15 mins

name: Thick Chocolate Pudding
ingredientsText:
1/3 cup sugar
1/4 cup baking cocoa
3 tablespoons cornstarch
1/8 teaspoon salt
2 cups milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Whipped topping, optional
preparationText:
In a 1-qt. microwave-safe bowl, combine the first four ingredients. Stir in milk until smooth. Microwave, uncovered, on high for 2 minutes; stir. Microwave 3-5 minutes longer or until thickened, stirring after each minute. Stir in vanilla. Pour into individual serving dishes; cool. Refrigerate. Garnish with whipped topping if desired.

Editor's Note: This recipe was tested in a 1,100-watt microwave.

name: Triple Berry Cream Pie
ingredientsText:
1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
4 tablespoons cold unsalted butter, cut into pieces
1/4 cup vegetable shortening, chilled
6 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature
3/4 cup confectioners' sugar
1 1/2 cups heavy cream
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 cups strawberries, hulled and cut into quarters (8 oz.)
1 (6 oz.) basket raspberries
1 (4.4 oz.) basket blueberries
preparationText: Make crust: Preheat oven to 400F. In a bowl, mix flour and salt. With a pastry blender or two knives, cut in butter and shortening until crumbly. Sprinkle with 3 Tbsp. ice water; mix with a fork just until dough forms a ball (add water if needed). Form into a disk, wrap in plastic and chill for 30 minutes. On a floured surface, roll out into an 11-inch round. Fit into a 9-inch pie pan and crimp edge. Refrigerate for 10 minutes. Line crust with foil and fill with pie weights. Bake for 6 minutes, remove foil and bake until lightly golden, 10 to 12 minutes. Let cool. Make filling: In a bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar with a mixer on high speed. Beat in cream and vanilla, scraping down sides of bowl, until fluffy and well-mixed. In another bowl, gently mix berries. Spoon two-thirds of cream mixture into crust; smooth top. Spoon two-thirds of berries over cream. Mound remaining cream in center and top with remaining berries. Chill for 1 to 4 hours.

name: Tropical Freeze
ingredientsText:
4 cups cream
3 cups milk
2 cups sugar
small can of lemon juice
small can of orange juice
6 mashed bananas.
preparationText: Boil milk and sugar.  Cool. Add cream, juices, and bananas. Freeze.

name: Uncooked cheesecake
ingredientsText:
8 ounces cream cheese
1 cup sugar
1 small lemon jello with 3/4 cup water
1 can of whipping cream or evaporated milk
2 tablespoons powdered sugar
1 can fruit pie filling (your favorite kind)

Crust
1 package graham crackers
1/4 cup butter
3 tablespoons sugar. Bake 10 minutes.
preparationText: Whip milk until stiff. Whip cream cheese until smooth, add powdered sugar to cream cheese. Then fold in whipped cream and vanilla. Add jello-partially gelled. Put into pan with baked graham cracker crust.  Top with fruit pie filling.

name: Upside-down Orange Biscuits
ingredientsText:
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 tablespoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
3 tablespoons shortening
3/4 cup milk
Topping
2 tablespoons butter, softened
1/4 cup sugar
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
Glaze
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 cup orange juice
3 tablespoons butter, melted
2 teaspoons grated orange peel
preparationText:
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt; cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk just until moistened. Turn onto a lightly floured surface; knead gently 10-12 times.
Roll into a 15 in x 12 in rectangle. Spread with butter. Combine sugar and cinnamon; sprinkle over butter. Roll up jelly-roll style, starting from the short side. Cut into 12 equal slices. Place, cut side down, in a greased 9 inch round baking pan.
Combine topping ingredients; pour over biscuits. Bake at 450 F for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool in pan 5 minutes; invert onto a platter and serve warm.

name: Winter Energy Cookies
ingredientsText:
1 cup butter
1 1/2 cup brown sugar
1/3 cup molasses
1/3 cup peanut butter
2 eggs
1 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
1 1/2 cup whole wheat flour
1 cup all purpose flour
1 cup wheat germ
1 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
2 cups rolled oats
1 cup raisins
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1 cup chopped walnuts

name: Zucchini Bread
ingredientsText:
3 cups flour
1 cup sugar
2 cups zucchini grated
3 eggs
1/3 cup oil
1 teaspoon salt
2 tablespoons baking powder
1 teaspoon soda
2 teaspoon vanilla
3 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 cup chocolate chip
preparationText: Bake at 325 F for 1 hour.
